issuetype.description: A small, distinct piece of work.
issuetype.name: Task

content.text: This task involves developing a comprehensive, technically rich brochure covering all aspects of Web Development services. The brochure will span over 2,900 words and include foundational services (static, dynamic, CMS-based), platform-specific builds (e.g., WordPress, Shopify, Headless CMS), backend and frontend engineering, custom API integration, DevOps, QA, performance optimization, and maintenance. Each section must follow brochure standards: ~35 words per paragraph, conversational yet precise tone, client-outcome-focused messaging, and consistent logical structure. Content should reflect real-world use cases, implementation depth, and tool/framework accuracy. Final version must be design-ready and aligned with VE’s content guidelines.
Deliverables:
Full-length brochure content segmented by service category
Final copy prepared for expert review and design handoff

resolution.description: Work has been completed on this work item.
resolution.name: Done

issuetype.description: A small, distinct piece of work.
issuetype.name: Task

content.text: This task involves writing high-quality, technically detailed content for the Software Development Services brochure. The brochure will cover foundational services (custom builds, product engineering), layered capabilities (backend, frontend, API, DevOps, QA), and industry-specific solutions (e.g., finance, healthcare, logistics). Content must follow the established style: ~35 words per paragraph, technically rich yet conversational, free from fluff, and written from a client-outcome perspective. Tone must remain consistent throughout while varying structure and approach across services. All sections must conclude with a logical, benefit-driven statement. The final version should be brochure-ready and optimized for review and design integration.
Deliverables:
Structured, category-wise content for all software services
Final copy adhering to tone, format, and technical accuracy guidelines

resolution.description: Work has been completed on this work item.

content.text: This task involves creating technically accurate, outcome-focused content for the .NET Services brochure. Content will cover core offerings such as enterprise-grade application development, system integration, cloud-native deployment (Azure), CI/CD setup, performance optimization, and post-launch support. Each section must follow the established 35-word limit, maintain a conversational yet technical tone, and conclude with a clear client benefit. Emphasis will be placed on real-world use cases, scalability, security, and architectural reliability. Final output must be logically structured and aligned with VE’s brochure content standards—ready for review and design.
Deliverables:
Full content set across .NET categories (e.g., Development, DevOps, Maintenance)
Final copy optimized for design integration and expert review

content.text: This task involves writing technically detailed, brochure-ready content for the PHP Development Services section. The content must cover core capabilities like custom development, Laravel-based builds, API integrations, e-commerce platforms, legacy support, and performance tuning. Each section will be limited to ~35 words, written in a client-oriented, outcome-driven tone. Emphasis will be placed on frameworks (Laravel, Symfony, CodeIgniter), backend optimization techniques, CI/CD pipelines, and scalability features. All copy must follow established brochure standards—logically structured, consistent in tone, technically accurate, and ready for design integration.

issuetype.description: A small, distinct piece of work.
issuetype.name: Task

content.text: This task covers writing a high-detail, technically rich section for the Mobile App Development Services brochure, focusing on a
single core service

(e.g., Native Android Development, Backend & API Integration, or CI/CD & DevOps for Mobile). The content must be structured for brochure use—concise (~35 words), logically connected, and outcome-driven. Tone must be client-facing but free from fluff, with technical accuracy on tools, frameworks, and architectural decisions (e.g., Jetpack Compose, Firebase, GraphQL, GitHub Actions). Final copy should reflect real implementation depth and practical engineering value, not generic marketing lines.
Goal:
Deliver a polished paragraph that can stand alone as part of a larger service category, maintaining tone, clarity, and logical flow per established brochure standards.

resolution.description: Work has been completed on this work item.
resolution.name: Done

fields.summary: Content: Mobile App Development Services Brochure (4000+ Words)

content.text: Key Points from the Meeting – Mobile App Development Services:
A brochure will be created to promote our Mobile App Development services to our prospects.
We will not be committing to end-to-end project delivery, as project management will be handled by the client.
Action Items:
Create and share an online document with list of sections to be included in the brochure - Tanumoy - 23rd July
Add inputs in the online document - Amit, Sumit, Vishal, Yunus - 24th July
We will meet tomorrow at 6pm.
Tanumoy has prepared a draft of our Mobile App Development Services brochure, covering all core, layered, and feature-based services.
Mobile_App_Development_Services_Brochure
Domain experts will add the following:
Any technical corrections or additions
Suggestions for missing service layers or features
Any other inputs to make this brochure stronger and more market-ready
Hi
. I have shared the content draft for review.
Mobile App Development Service Brochure

issuetype.description: A small, distinct piece of work.
issuetype.name: Task

content.text: This task involves writing, structuring, and refining content for the Android App Development brochure. The brochure will cover core services, layered offerings, and feature-specific capabilities tailored for Android platforms. The tone will be conversational yet technically rich, aligned with VE’s brochure standards. Content must highlight real-world use cases, advanced Android-specific features (e.g., AI chat, geolocation, AR/VR), and modular services like UI/UX, QA, DevOps, and performance optimization. Each section must maintain consistency in length (~35 words/paragraph), avoid repetition, and ensure logical flow. Final copy will be optimized for both technical clarity and marketing usability.
Deliverables:
Full brochure content including category titles, service descriptions, and feature-based offerings.
Final document ready for design handoff and internal/external review.

resolution.description: Work has been completed on this work item.
resolution.name: Done

fields.summary: Content: Andriod App Development Brochure (1200+ Words)

content.text: Hi
as discussed over call today, please work on the content of Andriod App development brochure. This requirement has come from Mobile app development team.
Hi
please share the link of the document that you have shared with SME for reveiw.
Hi
. Have already shared the brochure with the SME.
Hi
I am changing the staus of this as ‘On Hold’ as Sumit (SME) is currently busy with leads.
Attached are the freelancer's review document:
Android App Brochure - REVIEW REQUIRED.docx
whats need to fix (android app).pdf
We have asked for adding more details in the review document and freelancer will share it in 2-3 days.
Work Summary:
Content Development:
Draft was completed on schedule and shared with Sumit for initial review via email.
Internal Feedback:
All feedback from Sumit was implemented without delay. Revisions were made to match tone, structure, and technical accuracy as discussed.
External Review:
The finalized draft was forwarded to the designated external reviewer.
Issue Noted:
The external review was received; however, the feedback lacked depth, clarity, and actionable points. It did not meet the expected quality standards to move forward.
Next Steps:
Awaiting confirmation on whether a second round of review will be initiated or if final sign-off can proceed internally.
